result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Conditions added:

3:00 PM Defendant Nehemiah Lee Reiss in court, in custody.  Attorney William Henry Gergen in court for Nehemiah Lee Reiss.  Attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for State of Wisconsin. Court is appearing by video conference.  No objection to court appearing remotely.  Court finds victim rights compliant.  This is Attorney Gergen's motion to modify bail.  Attorney Gergen calls J.R., s/t.  Cross examination by Attorney Pack.  Witness excused.  No further witnesses by Attorney Gergen.  Closing arguments by Attorney Gergen, requesting reduction in bail from $50,000 to $5,000.  Attorney Pack heard, request bond remain as previously ordered.  Court heard, modifies cash bail to $15,000 with same conditions as previously set w/additional condition of no contact w/any potential witnesses including the mother of the victim and any of her children.  If defendant is able to post the cash bail, he shall be responsible for the fees associated the GPS through the Sheriff Department to monitor his whereabouts while out on bond.

Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 45 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't; Court orders NGI evaluation; sets Bond Motion for Hearing.

12:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney William Henry Gergen appeared by video for Nehemiah Lee Reiss. Defendant Nehemiah Lee Reiss in court, in custody. Atty. Gergen heard on Def.'s FTA, notes Def.'s address should be Dodge County Jail; Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State heard requests $50,000 Cash bond; Atty. Gergen response; Prelim requested within time limits. Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with any minor females. Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin while the case is pending.
